intro: Assonia thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant produces small, round fruits that resemble starfruits, hence its common name. Assonia thouarsii is typically found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It has a limited distribution and is considered a rare and endemic species.
